title: Another movie theater is shutting down in Massachusetts
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Showcase Cinema de Lux in Randolph is closing on March 1, ending operations at its standalone facility on Mazzeo Drive.
National Amusements owned the Randolph theater, part of a $2.4 billion acquisition by Paramount Skydance in 2025.
Randolph closure follows Patriot Place cinema shutdown; Phoenix Theaters is renovating Patriot Place for reopening this summer.

title: Giveaway: Enter to win tickets to a screening of ‘Midwinter Break’
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Love Letters is giving away 10 pairs of tickets to 'Midwinter Break' screening at AMC Boston Common on Feb. 19.
To enter, submit a relationship question to Love Letters by Feb. 17 at 11:59 p.m. EST.
The film 'Midwinter Break' is based on Bernard MacLaverty's 2017 novel about a couple's trip to Amsterdam.

title: Boston meteorologists are ‘watching’ the track of a storm for Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists are monitoring a storm that may approach Boston, affecting weather on Presidents' Day, February 16, 2026.
Confidence is low on the storm's path; it currently seems to be tracking offshore with uncertain impact on New England.
Boston temperatures will rise to 40Â°F for the first time in 20 days, with gradual warming expected into the weekend.

title: Kendrick Perkins explained why the Celtics are ‘the most dangerous team in the NBA’
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Kendrick Perkins labeled the Celtics the 'most dangerous team in the NBA' despite Jayson Tatum's injury.
Perkins highlighted Jaylen Brown's MVP candidacy, citing his top-five scoring and defensive stature.
Boston holds second place in the Eastern Conference, exceeding expectations amid roster challenges.

title: 4 State Police members relieved of duty as they face charges in recruit’s death
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Lt. Jennifer Penton and Troopers Edwin Rodriguez, David Montanez, and Casey LaMonte face manslaughter charges in Enrique Delgado-Garcia's 2024 death.
Delgado-Garcia died from a brain injury during unauthorized sparring at the MSP academy; officials charged the four with reckless conduct.
MSP suspended the four officers involved, and the academy's boxing exercises, pending duty status hearings and independent training reviews.

title: High-end Italian marketplace, Greek restaurant, luxury shops to replace Neiman Marcus at Copley Place
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Neiman Marcus at Copley Place will be replaced by Casa Tua Cucina, Estiatorio Milos, and luxury boutiques.
Simon announced the space will include boutiques like Dolce & Gabbana and expanded FENDI and Tourneau stores.
Construction for the new spaces begins later this year with phased openings planned through 2028.

title: Boston was just named funniest city in the U.S. Is it?
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston named funniest city in the U.S. by TicketSource, surpassing Washington, D.C. and Atlanta.
Study cites Boston's comedy scene, with high ticket demand and multiple comedy venues like The Wilbur.
Boston's humorous reputation also attributed to residents' everyday expressions and interactions, according to report.

title: Mass. snow totals by town: See who got the most from fast-moving overnight system
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Gloucester recorded the highest snow total from the overnight storm with 6 inches, following a January storm of 27 inches.
Most towns in Massachusetts reported 1 to 3 inches of snow, according to the National Weather Service.
Essex County locations like Methuen and Ipswich measured around 3.5 inches of snowfall during the storm.

title: $8M South End penthouse in converted church has views of Prudential Center
author: Regina Cole
bullets: The $8 million penthouse in the South End is part of a condominium complex at the converted Concord Baptist Church.
Built in 1868, the church was vacated by its congregation in 2011 and converted into nine luxury condos, keeping its historic exterior.
The 3,508 sq ft unit has a two-story design with features like direct elevator access, custom finishes, and views of Prudential Center.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 11)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: A property at 25 Upton St. in Boston sold for $4,035,000; it is a 16-room row-middle home.
In Arlington, 56 Valentine Road, a four-bedroom Colonial, sold for $2,100,000 on a 7,971-square-foot lot.
A condo at 1025 Massachusetts Ave. #312 in Arlington sold for $332,700, featuring one bedroom and two baths.
